name: 4-(4-chlorophenyl)-4-hydroxypiperidine
Reason: 4-chlorophenyl group can increase the melting point due to the presence of a bulky and electronegative functional group, which can lead to a higher melting point by approximately +20°C. The hydroxyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to hydrogen bonding and dipole-dipole interactions, which can raise it by approximately +10°C. The piperidine ring can also contribute to the melting point due to its rigidity and the presence of a basic nitrogen atom, which can increase it by approximately +10°C.
